intro: Grypothrix simplex, commonly known as the simple grypothrix, is a rare and enigmatic plant species belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a delicate and ecologically significant species.
